Translations are stored in the i18n directory inside the system resources directory. There is a language configuration file `languages.xml` that defines the path for each language key and the default language path.
Language path may be a YAML file or a directory that contains multiple YAML files (included nested folders and both `yml` and `yaml` file extensions).
Example of language configuration file: ``` <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <languages default="en_us"> <language key="en_US" path="en_us" /> <language key="es_ES" path="es_es" /> </languages> ```
YAML file content is simple format code:translation where `code` is the key that will be used from the code in order to get the translation. Example:
``` delete_document_button.statustip: "Delete document from project." delete_document_button.tooltip: "Delete current document" delete_document_button.text: "Delete" ```
Archetype repositories may have their own translations. Archetypes strings are handle in a different way to allow showing the default string in case a valid translation is not found (repository may not be translated or translated in languages not supported by the current application setup).
